details.title: Congress gives adjournment notice in Lok Sabha over mob lynching issue
details.content:
Congress has given adjournment notice in Lok Sabha over the issue of mob lynching. pic.twitter.com/9nOQRFL7Cq

— ANI (@ANI) July 19, 2018

details.title: DMK supports the no confidence motion brought by TDP, says MK Stalin
details.content: In spite of having no option to vote for NoConfidenceMotion in Parliament, DMK supports the no confidence motion brought by TDP. We request AIADMK also to support no confidence motion in Parliament: MK Stalin, DMK Working President. (ANI)
TDP MP JC Diwakar Reddy refuses to attend crucial session, says he is 'fed up'.

details.title: YSRCP MPs stage protest
details.content:
YSRCP MPs stage protest in Parliament premises demanding special status for Andhra Pradesh. #MonsoonSession pic.twitter.com/ScKBXckZpN

— ANI (@ANI) July 19, 2018
Congress MPs stage protest against proposed MSP announced by the Modi Government. (Photo| Shekhar Yadav/ EPS)

Opposition to oppose the amendment of RTI Act

Every Indian has the right to know the truth. The BJP believes the truth must be hidden from the people and they must not question people in power. The changes proposed to the RTI will make it a useless Act. They must be opposed by every Indian. #SaveRTI pic.twitter.com/4mjBTwQnYK

— Rahul Gandhi (@RahulGandhi) July 19, 2018
Congress President Rahul Gandhi likely to speak tomorrow over the No Confidence Motion. Seven hours alloted for discussion tomorrow, one hour allotted to Congress alone.

TDP President & Andhra CM N Chandrababu Naidu writes a letter to all MPs, states "In view of continued adamant attitude of BJP led NDA Govt, TDP has moved No Confidence Motion against them. I appeal to you to support the motion moved by our MPs". (ANI)

details.title: Ruckus in Lok Sabha
details.content: A ruckus breaks out in the lower house of the Parliament as opposition raises anti-Modi slogan.
Congress President Rahul Gandhi today attacked the BJP government over proposed changes to the Right to Information Act, saying they will render the law useless.

BJD MP Prasanna Acharya in Rajya Sabha said that nearly 500 jawans committed suicides in the country, comparing it to farmer suicides across states. He said, 'Maro jawan, maro kisaan', is the condition now.

Prime Minister Narendra Modi said that The United Progressive Alliance (UPA) government that was in power at the Centre from 2004 to 2014, failed miserably to live up to their promise to provide electricity across the country.

Congress leaders call out the incompetent Modi Govt on for all round failure in governance. @GauravGogoiAsm @sushmitadevmp @ShashiTharoor @SATAVRAJEEV pic.twitter.com/Kch1RnDChR

— Congress (@INCIndia) July 19, 2018

details.title: Baijayant Jay Panda's resigns
details.content: Lok Sabha Speaker accepts BJD MP Baijayant Jay Panda's resignation reducing the strength in Lok Sabha to 533.

Kerala Chief minister Pinarayi Vijayan along with Kerala MP's after a meeting with the Prime minister Narendra Modi (EPS/Shekhar Yadav).

|

Congress MP KC Venugopal urges Centre to bring measures to reduce attacks against people with different views, curb lynchings. He also brought in the incidents of Swami Agnivesh's attack and Union MoS Jayant Sinha's garlanding of convicts.

details.title: Rajnath Singh calls lynching 'state's concern'
details.content:
Home Minister Rajnath Singh answering Congress MP K C Venugopal's question on lynching, said,"It's true that people have lost their lives due to lynching and I condemn it. Lynching is state's concern but the Central government has taken measures to curb fake news".

READ | Mob lynchings due to economic disparity: BJP MP Meenakshi Lekhi

"We have asked social media service providers to install checks in their system to prevent such incidents. Such incidents are unfortunate and I request state governments to take appropriate actions against the culprits", added Rajnath Singh.
Congress MPs walk out of Parliament following Home Minister Rajnath Singh's comment on lynchings.
We will see today & tomorrow that which regional parties get together with Congress as a B team: Ram Madhav, BJP National General Secretary.
Rajya Sabha adjourned till 2 pm.
Lok Sabha adjourned till 2.10 pm.
Biju Janata Dal(BJD) issues whip, directs MPs to be present in Lok Sabha tomorrow for the No Confidence Motion.

details.title: This is not a game of ping pong that states and Centre keep shifting responsibilities: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor
details.content:
The Home Minister's statement in Lok Sabha on mob lynching was not satisfactory at all, that is why we staged a walkout from the house. This is not a game of ping pong that states and Centre keep shifting responsibilities: Shashi Tharoor,Congress MP pic.twitter.com/Tn0BMCm1XA

— ANI (@ANI) July 19, 2018

We haven't brought this. It is Andhra's issue & they brought this. We in Tamil Nadu struggled for 22 days in Parliament for Cauvery Mgmt Board issue. We stalled proceedings. Who came to us? Which state came forward & helped in our cause?: TN CM E.K Palaniswami on No Confidence Motion (ANI)
ANI reports: BJP President Amit Shah spoke to Shiv Sena Chief Uddhav Thackeray over phone for No Confidence Motion, say sources.

In the last two years money going to Swiss Banks has increased. You said money will be deposited into people's bank accounts but instead of that money went outside India, says Congress leader Anand Sharma in Rajya Sabha (ANI)

details.title: No confidene Motion: SP's Ram Gopal Yadav gets abusive
details.content:
#WATCH Samajwadi Party MP Ram Gopal Yadav on being asked about party's stand on #NoConfidenceMotion, uses a cuss word. pic.twitter.com/R9AhlU2hhQ

— ANI (@ANI) July 19, 2018
Shiv Sena will vote against the No Confidence Motion. The party has issued a whip for its MPs, directing them to support the government.

details.title: Shares flat ahead of Friday's no trust vote
details.content: Shares were muted on Thursday with losses in heavyweights such as Tata Consultancy Services Ltd offsetting gains in consumer stocks including Hindustan Unilever Ltd, a day ahead of a no-confidence motion against the government, reported Reuters.
Aam Aadmi Party issues whip, directs its MPs to vote in favour of No Confidence Motion.
Discussion underway at Lok Sabha on the Fugitive Economic Offenders Bill, 2018.

details.title: As long as I'm in BJP,I'll support it & follow every whip: BJP MP Shatrughan Sinha
details.content: I think there are intellectuals in opposition but they should've done it later. Because we have the numbers & our moral is also up. I haven't left BJP & party has't left me. As long as I'm in BJP,I'll support it & follow every whip: BJP MP Shatrughan Sinha on No trust vote
The BJP today made light of the Congress's claim that the Opposition had the numbers to back its no-confidence motion against the government.  READ FULL REPORT.

Fugitive Economic Offenders ordinance is the need of the hour.Cases where the total value involved in such offences is Rs.100 crore or more, will come under its purview. Till 2014 nothing was done on this front: Piyush Goyal, Finance Minister in Lok Sabha
The ruling BJD in Odisha will reveal its stand on the Opposition-sponsored no-confidence motion against the NDA-led Centre on the floor of the Parliament tomorrow, a senior party leader said.

The Fugitive Economic Offenders Bill, 2018 has been passed in Lok Sabha, reports ANI.  The Bill seeks to target fugitives for offences where the monetary value exceeds Rs 100 crore. The bill will extend to loan defaulters, fraudsters and also those individuals who violate laws governing taxes, black money, benami properties, financial sector and corruption. The Bill, when it becomes a law, will empower the government to confiscate assets of offenders like Nirav Modi and Vijay Mallya.

Hindu population in Bangladesh increasing: Sushma Swaraj in Rajya Sabha 

External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj speaks in the Rajya Sabha during the Monsoon session of Parliament in New Delhi on Thursday July 19 2018. (Photo | PTI)

Lok Sabha adjourned for the day. Will resume business on Friday 11 am.

Dr Boora Narsaiah Goud,TRS: "OBCs are the backbone of India. Most of the MSMEs run by OBCs. Congress hugged the PM but if the Congress would have hugged us OBCs once in a 25 years, they would have known our pain. We should ask pain of Patel's Marathas. OBCs representaition is mere 9% against the reservation of 25%""
